items.title: There's no one way to mark Australia Day — as communities across the nation are making clear
items.description: People around the country are marking Australia Day with citizenship ceremonies, traditional dances, smoking ceremonies and fun runs, as the prime minister calls for "unity not division" during a speech in Canberra.

items.title: More than 1,100 properties told to evacuate near Vic Otways fire
items.description: Residents from more than 1,100 properties near Victoria's Otways bushfire have been asked to evacuate before sunset ahead of extreme fire conditions on Tuesday.

items.title: How hot is it? Track Australia Day heatwave temperatures live
items.description: Use our tracker to keep an eye on temperatures as a heatwave moves across much of the country.

items.title: Paying 'money just to breathe' in one the world's most polluted cities
items.description: Poor air quality in Delhi has impacted nearly all aspects of life with residents saying they have lost many of the "simple joys" such as opening a window or going for a walk outside.

items.title: Live: Aussie women's doubles pair in dramatic final set as fourth round singles continue
items.description: Defending Australian Open champion Madison Keys is beaten by friend and Player's Box podcast co-host Jessica Pegula on Rod Laver Arena to start day nine of the Australian Open. Follow live.

items.title: Influx of influencers leaves tennis fans frustrated at Australian Open
items.description: Many long-time tennis fans have levelled some frustration at the influx of influencers who have descended on Melbourne Park, as they battle long lines, overcrowding and increased ticket prices.

items.title: Patriots, Seahawks to face off in San Francisco for Super Bowl LX
items.description: New England survived a Denver blizzard and Seattle outlasted Los Angeles in an offensive shootout to set up a bumper clash for Super Bowl LX.

items.title: Wild winter storm leaves hundreds of thousands of Americans without power
items.description: A massive winter storm across much of the US, spreading from Texas all the way to New England, affects powerlines, traffic and air travel.

items.title: Trump's economic chaos makes Keynes's idea look attractive
items.description: In the wake of Trump, the world will now have to revisit the conference that set up the "rules-based world order".

items.title: The collateral damage from Trump's quest to deport immigrants
items.description: Minneapolis has become the flashpoint of an aggressive immigration enforcement operation ordered by the Trump administration and pitched as a campaign against undocumented criminals.

items.title: Bystander videos show violent takedown before fatal shooting in Minneapolis
items.description: Multiple videos have emerged of nurse Alex Pretti before he was shot dead by federal agents in Minneapolis. The videos appear to contradict statements by the Trump administration, which said the shots were fired "defensively" against Mr Pretti as he "approached" authorities with a gun. In bystander videos, Mr Pretti is seen with only a phone in his hand, before US federal agents use pepper spray and wrestle him to the ground before opening fire.

items.title: A discreet intellectual network has been reshaping the world for 70 years. Here's how
items.description: A constant battle of ideas reshapes the world we live in, and few groups have been more successful in winning the war than the little-known Atlas Network.

items.title: Moderate Liberals 'rock solid' behind Sussan Ley amid leadership whispers
items.description: While conservatives Angus Taylor and Andrew Hastie canvass support to challenge for the Liberal leadership, moderates say there is no mood for turning on Sussan Ley — meaning a spill would likely result in another divided vote.

items.title: Police face 45-degree day as Lake Cargelligo manhunt continues
items.description: Police are searching a property in the Mount Hope district as the hunt for a man wanted in connection with the shooting deaths of three people in a NSW town enters its fifth day.

items.title: Gold's record run rolls on as prices surge past $US5,000
items.description: Gold surges to a record high above $US5,000 an ounce, extending a historic rally as investors pile into the safe-haven asset amid rising geopolitical tensions.

items.title: Rental deemed 'not habitable' by tribunal still being leased out
items.description: Furnished accommodation company ShareSorted was found in breach of its obligations related to at least two properties, but a lack of regulation allows them to continue to operate.

items.title: The 150 Indigenous kids who made a movie without Hollywood's permission
items.description: The beautifully animated, crowdsourced movie Imagine introduces a wealth of Indigenous knowledge to audiences in the funniest way possible and hopes to generate real change.

items.title: 1960s films restored in hope of enticing new migrants to regional Australia
items.description: The National Film and Sound Archive has released 4K restorations of the 1960s film series Life in Australia, commissioned by the Department of Immigration to attract new migrants to regional Australia.

items.title: How to know if you're 'stuck' on unhealthy life goals
items.description: Experts say knowing when to abandon or change your goals may be just as important as persistence.

items.title: Indonesian rescuers search for dozens missing after West Java landslide
items.description: Dozens of people remain missing — many feared buried under mud, rocks and uprooted trees — after a landslide on Indonesia's main island of Java.

items.title: Bodies recovered after ferry sinks in the Philippines
items.description: Rescuers are searching for missing passengers and at least 15 are dead, after a ferry with more than 300 people onboard sunk in the southern Philippines.

items.title: I found a trove of letters from 1959. Their predictions were eerily familiar
items.description: I had been trawling absent-mindedly through the ABC's internal digital archive in a vague search for inspiration and clicked on this file called "Letters to the Unborn" at random.

items.title: 'Ray of hope' for missing man's parents after meeting with police minister
items.description: The parents of missing Jack McLennan say they have drawn some comfort from a meeting with Queensland Police Minister Dan Purdie.

items.title: Home invasion in Sale could be a case of 'mistaken identity', police say
items.description: Wellington Crime Investigation detectives turn to the public for help as they continue to investigate a 2025 home invasion where they allege three men broke in and assaulted a woman.

items.title: Heartbreak as home owner discovers roof was ripped off by Tropical Cyclone Luana
items.description: A family's home in WA's far north was "all but destroyed" by Tropical Cyclone Luana. The system, now a tropical low, is tracking inland across the Kimberley.
